intro: Cecropia monostachya, commonly known as the giant ceiba, is a fast-growing, deciduous tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, buttressed roots and a tall, straight trunk that can reach heights of up to 40 meters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and often have a waxy coating. Its flowers are small and clustered in panicles, and it produces woody, elongated fruits containing numerous seeds. Cecropia monostachya plays an important role in tropical ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various species.
